text: George Vincent "Vince" Gilligan Jr. (born February 10, 1967) is an American television writer, producer and director. He is best known for creating the AMC drama series Breaking Bad (2008–2013) and its spin-off Better Call Saul (2015–present). He also wrote and produced for the science fiction series The X-Files and was one of the creators of its spin-off The Lone Gunmen (2001). Gilligan was born in Richmond, Virginia. He has been with his girlfriend, Holly Rice, since 1991.
